content: Does the Mobile push notification service require an outgoing port opened on the firewall other than 80 or 443?
@Scott Russell nope, it uses port 443.
I suppose we should mention that in the docs on ports somewhere.

(Did you find your way to http://zulip.readthedocs.io/en/latest/production/requirements.html#network-and-security-specifications before asking that question? That's the obvious place to put that fact)
I did find my way there first. :) Any plans to link it from the Gear menu?
@Scott Russell I'm not sure what you're suggesting?

@Tim Abbott probably a silly thing... why are the zulip.readthedocs.io not linked from the upper right gear menu? We have user docs there. Maybe either inside of Help Center or a link below Help Center for Administration Documents?

well, there are a lot more users than server administrators. But arguably we could conditionally add a link there if you're a realm administrator on a non-zulipchat.com deployment.

In any case I agree we should at least link to readthedocs from the help center; I'll add it to the footer and maybe add it to the intro text at https://zulipchat.com/help/.
Thanks. No big deal if not. I guess I wondered why it hasn't been and you answered that too.
Hmm, the link for realm administators in gear menu is actually a pretty good idea.
